polimi.reds.broker.overlay
Class SimpleTopologyManager

java.lang.Object
  polimi.reds.broker.overlay.AbstractTopologyManager
      polimi.reds.broker.overlay.SimpleTopologyManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConnectivityChangeListener, DataListener, TopologyManager
public class SimpleTopologyManager
extends AbstractTopologyManager

A topology manager that does not restrict the overlay to assume any specific topology and does not try to keep the overlay connected when links/brokers die. It only prohibits opening more than a single link with the same neighbor.

See Also:
addNeighbor(String)

Method Detail

addNeighbor

public NodeDescriptor addNeighbor(java.lang.String url)
                           throws NotRunningException,
                                  java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                  AlreadyNeighborException,
                                  java.net.ConnectException
Connects to the node located at the specified URL. If everything goes right the specified node becomes a new neighbor and the NeighborAddedListeners registered are notified of the new neighbor, otherwise an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
url - the URL of the node to connect.
Returns:
the NodeDescriptor of the new neighbor.
Throws:
NotRunningException - if the topology manager is not running.
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the given URL has a wrong format.
AlreadyNeighborException - if the broker was already a neighbor.
java.net.ConnectException - if the connection fails.
See Also:
tentativelyAddNeighbor(String)

tentativelyAddNeighbor

public void tentativelyAddNeighbor(java.lang.String url)
                            throws NotRunningException,
                                   java.net.MalformedURLException
Description copied from interface: TopologyManager
Try connecting to the node located at the specified URL. If everything goes right the specified node becomes a new neighbor and the NeighborAddedListeners registered are notified of the new neighbor. If connecting with the specified node violates some constraints among those enforced by this TopologyManager, this method does nothing (it does not open the new connection and it does not notify the listeners).

Parameters:
url - The URL of the node to connect.
Throws:
NotRunningException - If the topology manager is not running.
java.net.MalformedURLException - If the given URL has a wrong format or a transport knowing the corresponding protocol (see Transport.knowsProtocol(String)) was not added.
See Also:
TopologyManager.addNeighbor(String)

removeNeighbor

public void removeNeighbor(NodeDescriptor node)
Description copied from interface: TopologyManager
Disconnects from the specified neighbor. If everything goes right the connection is closed and the NeighborhoodChangeListeners registered are notified. If the specified node was not a neighbor of the local node, this method does nothing.

Parameters:
node - The node to disconnect.

isNeighborOf

public boolean isNeighborOf(NodeDescriptor neighbor)
Description copied from interface: TopologyManager
Checks whether the givn node is a neighbor of the local node.

Returns:
True if the given node is a neighbor, false otherwise.

getLinkFor

public Link getLinkFor(NodeDescriptor neighbor)
Description copied from interface: TopologyManager
Retrieves the link used to communicate with the given neighbor. If the specified node is not a neighbor it returns null. If several links connect this node with the specified neighbor, one of them is returned (non deterministically).

Parameters:
neighbor - the neighbor to retrieve the link for.
Returns:
the link connecting this node with the specified neighbor or null if the specified node is not a neighbor.

getNeighborFor

public NodeDescriptor getNeighborFor(Link link)
Description copied from interface: TopologyManager
Retrieves the node descriptor of the neighbor connected through the given link. If the specified link does not exist it returns null.

Parameters:
link - the link to retrieve the neighbor for.
Returns:
the node descriptor of the neighbor connected through the given link.

                              Link source,
                              java.io.Serializable data)
Description copied from interface: DataListener
This method is called whenever a new data item arrives from a neighbor of the local node.

Parameters:
subject - The subject the data was addressed to.
source - The Link the data comes from.
data - The received data item.

getSubjectsToListenFor

protected java.lang.String[] getSubjectsToListenFor()
Description copied from class: AbstractTopologyManager
Subclasses must implement this method to inform this abstract topology manager about the set of subjects of data it is interested to receive from the transports connected.

Specified by:
getSubjectsToListenFor in class AbstractTopologyManager
Returns:
the set of subjects to listen for (from transports connected to this topology manager).
